model = linear_model.LinearRegression()
model.fit(X.reshape(30,5), y)
source.18294c03:
r_sq = model.score(X.reshape(30,5), y)
print('coefficient of determination:', r_sq)

print('intercept:', model.intercept_)

print('slope:', model.coef_)
source.9db5ccf8:
Ys = LogPlanetMass
# Concatenate the variables into a matrix, np.ones_like inserts a row of ones into the start of the matrix for the intercept term.
# Taking the transpose places each variable as columns.
Xmat = np.array((np.ones_like(LogPlanetRadius), LogPlanetRadius, LogPlanetOrbit, StarMetallicity, LogStarMass, LogStarAge)).T
import numpy.linalg
# The beta estimator using the matrix inversion formula
betaVec = numpy.linalg.inv(Xmat.T.dot(Xmat)).dot(Xmat.T).dot(Ys)
print(betaVec)
source.f257c5cf:
Data Analysis on Exoplanet regression

Let 𝑦 be the vector of LogPlanetMass. Then place the remaining variables so that they form columns of 𝑋. You should also insert an additional column of ones to allow for an intercept, thus you will have six 𝛽 parameters.

The lay-out of 𝑋 should be, left-to-right: intercept, LogPlanetRadius, LogPlanetOrbit, StarMetallicity, LogStarMass, LogStarAge.

Find the estimate of 𝜷 using multi linear least squares regression in python. What is 𝜷̂ to three significant figures in each element?
